title: John Arne Riise put on the spot when asked whether he would rather play for Jurgen Klopp of Pep Guardiola

John Arne Riise was put on the spot when asked who he would rather play under; Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp or Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola. 
The former Reds man answered pretty quickly, selecting the safe bet in Klopp, but not for the reasons you'd immediately think. 
According to Riise, the German plays the type of football he is himself attracted to - or rather, the type that suits his style. 
But that is not to say he doesn't have much respect for what the Spaniard has achieved in football, especially at his beloved Barcelona. John Arne Riise was put on the spot when asked to pick between the two managers (Photo: YouTube/Stadium Astro) 
Speaking on Stadium Astro, in Malaysia, during Astro SuperSport's Live EPL coverage show, the 36-year-old answered the difficult question. 
"I would play for Klopp because of the style he plays suits my style better. Going forward more, that kind of thing, his style suits me more. Klopp and Guardiola embrace after Man City's game with Liverpool (Photo: Michael Regan) 
"But I love Guardiola, for what he did at Barcelona, I'm a Barcelona fan, and the way he plays the football. 
"Sometimes he is too stubborn, I guess Monaco is a big proof of that, that he won't change his style." Riise said Klopp's style of football suits his own (Photo: Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images) 
The two Premier League heavyweights locked horns on Sunday in a tight game that finished 1-1. 
James Milner put the away side ahead from the penalty spot, before Sergio Aguero equalised down the other end. The former Liverpool defender revealed he "loves" Guardiola (Photo: Getty) 
Neither side did enough to win the game, but City would have felt aggrieved not to have been awarded a penalty for a Milner foul on Raheem Sterling in the area. poll loading Who is the best manager in the Premier League? 5000+ VOTES SO FAR
